page.title: 16THE BUILDING OF THE M 25
page.content:
Traffic has been a major problem during 1985. This is because the M 25 is being built from Poyle to Denham. Traffic travelling between these two points has to travel through Harmondsworth and West Drayton to Uxbridge along with airport traffic travelling to and from the north. Ii is also the route to which one can join the M 40 and M 1. The M 4 spur road into the airport has meant a decline in the traffic running through the villages of Harmondsworth and Sipson. Some local companies who operate heavy vehicles like Drinkwater Sabey have agreed to use the M 4 spur road to avoid going through the village of Sipson.
The peak time for congestion on the roads is in the morning between 3.30 a.m. and 9.00 a.m.
